text: 50cl bottle from Sip, Tallinn. Pours clear dark mahogany coloured with a modest, beige head. A bit milder smoke aroma than expected, but itÂ’s still dominating. Malt, caramel and hints bonfire. Sweet, but quite balanced also surprisingly balanced flavourwise with pleasant smoke flavours and hints of dried fruits. Smooth and enjoyable.
Piwo wypite jakiÅ› czas temu. Ocena wystawiona na podstawie wspomnieÅ„ z degustacji, w ramach uzupeÅ‚nienia profilu.

500ml bottle at the 2017 Cambridge Beer Festival. Dark mahogany/brown and translucent. Fair bit of carbonation but very little resultant head. Heavy smoke on the aroma but there is also a good dollop of chocolate malt. The bitter taste perseveres to the finish. ItÂ’s far from subtle but lovely nonetheless. Blackberry, burnt sausage, bitter chocolate and yest extract combine in the ambrosial aftertaste. A great beer, maybe a bit heavy for what it is but I expected that! Delicious.

At Chappies social house. Pours dark dark brown with a paper tin white head. Aroma and taste. of toasted burnt wood and or smoked sausage. Finishes with continued liquid smoke. I appreciate the effort but not for me. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy

Aromaty wÄ™dzonego sera Å¼Ã³Å‚tego, jakichÅ› domowych wÄ™dlin. W tym piwie mÃ³gÅ‚bym siÄ™ kÄ…paÄ‡. Wszystko, ale to naprawdÄ™ wszystko w nim jest dla mnie perfekcyjne. Dym, sÅ‚ody, Å›lady chmielu. Genialne.
Greetings from Bydgoszcz, Poland to all Beer Geeks and Hopheads around the world!
Dark brown with an off-white head. Medium body. Aroma of smoked sausage, wood and dark toffee. Flavour very malty, quite sweet, with molasses and dried fruit. Very good.

UPDATED: MAY 14, 2017 Pretty intense aroma of smoked ham with notes of wood and malty roasted base. Deep brown in the glass with thick off-white head. Flavor is dominated by huge smokiness, a lot of meat, wooden notes and ashy background. Finish reminds some carbonized ham. Ass kicking brew.
European Beer Swap Tasting #7 typowa schlenkerla. DuÅ¼o ogniskowej wÄ™dzonki, ciemny, wpadajÄ…cy w orzechy posmak sÅ‚odu. GÅ‚adziutkie. TreÅ›ciwe. Chyba mÃ³j ulubieniec z rodzinki.

50cl bottle from beer4u, sÃ£o paulo. Color is hazy red brown black. Head is thin and beige. Medium body. Dry finish. Medium bitterness. Carbonation is medium. Aroma is chocolate, smoke, wood, fruity, coffee. Flavour is chocolate, smoke, bacon, smoked salmon, light coffee, licorice, raisins. This is so good.

21. 4. 2017, Ljubljana. Bottled. Mellowed down version of Fastenbier with a bit toned down aroma and flavour, but still smokin'. Almost silky mouthfeel with almost black colour. Good.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma a leÃ±a y humo
Buen aspecto caoba transparente y espuma persistente
En boca dos punch. El primero dulce a caramelo y regaliz. El segundo final seco y ahumado

From bottle to mug. Pour is a dark brown cola color with a lively head that was thick and tan. Nose is huge malt, smoke, roasted wood. Taste is medium bodied, sweet with a bit of sourness from the smoke. Finishes thick on the mouth with a smooth smoky finish. Great

Bottle. Pours dark brown-black with thin light beige head that dissipates quickly. Smoke aroma dominates. Heavy smoke malt upfront with seaweed and oyster notes. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle shared at home. Dark brown with thin white head. Liquid black bacon. Bbq special, damn. Caramelized burnt bacon with pine resin. Medium sweet, moderate bitter, I guess this is pretty umami, all though IÂ’m not sure I believe in umami. Medium body, soft carbonation. Damn tasty. Crazy.

Bottle shared thanks to sjogro. Clear reddish brown with beige head. Lots of bacon, ash, caramel, dried peach, red grapes, more smoke and ash, light mineral, toffee. Massive smoke. Just medium sweet and bitter. Medium bodied with slick feel. Probably a decent beer but the excessive smoke ruins most of it.
Very good beer with nice ruby colour and smoke aroma. Taste is light bitter and smoked. Much better than others smoked beer available in Poland (besides other schlenkerla beer).

0,5l bottle at home bought from Beergonzo. BB 08/2017. dark brown color, rather big off-white head. smells of bacon, earthy, light smoke, tomates, spices, nice smell. full body, light carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes of smoked sausages, bacon, some caramel, spices, bit peppery, some ripe fruits, bit nutty, tobacco. finishes rather light with notes of sausages, caramel and ripe fruits. nice one overall. looses a bit towards the finish but overall quite nice beer.

Bottle, thanks to SinH4 for supplying me with the great beers of this Brewery! Pours a dark brown with a light brown head. Aroma of a classic smoke room people around here cooked in a century ago. Smoked bacon, a hint of caramel, dark red berries, roast, a bit earthy. Sweet, a bit tart, medium bitterness, a bit salty even. Medium body with lively, soft carbonation. 
Amped up Schlenkerla MÃ¤rzen. More smoke than bacon. A very good beer.

Zapach intensywny, wÄ™dzonka, dym, bekon, ognisko, drewno, karmel, ciemne owoce. Kolor ciemnobrÄ…zowy, klarowne. Piana beÅ¼owa, Å›rednio obfita, drobna, Å›rednio trwaÅ‚a, zdobi szkÅ‚o. W smaku umiarkowana sÅ‚odycz, Å›rednia peÅ‚nia, wÄ™dzonka, dym, ognisko, karmel, drewno. Goryczka Å›rednia, wysycenie niskie.
Aroma is loads of smoke... smokey bacon, campfire... flavour is rich, red berries, caramel treacle toffee malts, more smoke and wood... thick body, slightly oily. Really good, and strangely moreish.

Fantastic aroma - smoked wood, caramel, bread, raisins - quite a bit of depth for 6.5 abv beer. Taste is also rich in those notes present in aroma. A bit of sweetness, medium-low herbal bitterness, just enough carbonation. Very solid beer that I could drink a lot. Very good drinkability.

Shared bottle at Olut Sabadell. Caoba coloured. Clear. White nice head, vanishes fast. Nice smoked aroma. Lightly malted body, a bit olily.

(Aecht Schlenkerla Rauchbier Urbock) Bottle 500ml from SinH4, thanks Stefan! Served into a dimpled mug, ABV 6.5%
Dark mahogany brown colour on the body, tall and thick, creamy beige head on top, with very good retention.
Aroma has plenty of smoke, has caramel on the back, burnt wood.
Taste is of soft smoke, hints of caramel, a little bit of smoked meats.
Medium thick body, good carbonation, quite dry on the palate.
Nice one.

Color is copper red, slightly brownish, it looks crystal clear to me. Aroma is smoked bacon and mountain smoked cheese. Taste is sweet at first sight probably from caramel malts, in the beginig maybe some fruitiness. After that comes strong smoked ham flavour. Aftertaste is mix of both sweet and smoky. ItÂ’s quite thick for its extract. In general i donÂ’t like smoked beers but Schlenkerla products are exceptions.

BB 03/2017. Poured a translucent (just) dark brown with a 5mm light tan dense foam head that retained extremely well and laced very well. Carbonation high, lively and coarse. Aroma very strongly of open-fire smoked bacon and smoked ham; very similar smoked characters to the MÃ¤rzen  Rauchbier. Taste initially of sweet dark malt followed quickly by lots of very strong open-fire like smoked ham and bacon; low bitterness. Medium to heavy body. Smooth with a nice smokey finish.
kolor ciemny, piana Å‚adna, dorbna, utrzymujÄ…ca siÄ™. Aromat drewna, chleb ciemny, bekon, szynka, wedzonka, kielbasa. W smaku sÅ‚odko-palono. Wyscyenie niskie, chmielowosc niska. Bardzo dobre piwo

Bottle. And Draft. Mahogany coloured smoked beer. Off-white head. Mega smokey aroma; smoked ham, campfire. Sweet Malty; smoked malts, roasty, toffee/caramel, woody. Hoppy; nice balancing hop bitterness. Good smoke/malt/hop balance dominated by the smoke. Smooth and complex. Sweet smokey roast malts and caramel throughout. Smokey and dry finish. Terrific. Wonderful Smoked Beer! (2008)

Draught at Akkurat. 
Pours dark brown with a tan head. 
Sweet taste of peat, tarr pastils and dark chocolate.

Draft at akkurat 
Dark black, off white head
Aroma of smoke, ham
Taste sweet smoke, slight bitter. Full texture.

Oh Mann. Wahnsinn!!! Wie wundervoll sich im richtigen Winkel zum Licht ein funkelndes Rot im ansonsten tiefschwarzen Sud offenbart. Wow. 50 cl bottle. Big beer, dark colour, deep red against the light, thick beige head. Smoked ham (palvikinkku) aromas all the way and some oak, very soft aromas. Taste is a bit more malty, the smokiness more in your face, perhaps because of the carbonation (medium). Mouthfeel is even a little sticky. Medium+ body. Taste could deliver on the aromas better, but still a classic.

Oh man ich liebe die Schlenkerla Rauchbiere. Das Urbock ist Vollmundiger und weniger bitter als das MÃ¤rzen. Der Rauch ist feiner und es ist insgesamt sÃ¼ÃŸer. Ich mag beide sehr, aber das Urbock finde ich leicht besser, mal sehen wie die Eiche ist ;)

Tap at The Office a long time ago. Aroma: Well... just smoked ham and bonfire, some bread. Appearance: Mediocre head, dark brown body. Taste: Very smoky, lots of smoked meat and bonfire notes, bready maltiness, light caramel. Palate: Semi-sweet finish, high body, low carbonation.

Bottle. Clear dark red colour, small durable tan head. Intense aroma of smoke - ham, bacon, wood, caramel and dark bread. Taste is medium sweet and light to medium bitter, ham, caramel, bread, biscuit in the beginning, followed by heavier notes of smoke and wood, roasty in the finish. Medium+ body, oily texture, average carbonation. Really complex and well-balanced. Another flavourful smoked beer - I prefer this to Rauchbier Marzen.

Dark brown color. Good carbonation. Intense bacon-like smokiness in the nose, but not not harsh, lovely really. Deep malty aroma, a touch of caramel hiding in there. Taste is rich and malty, goes on forever. Nice caramel, a bit of chocolate, dried fruits, surprisingly effervescent, great herbal, floral hop balance, some roasted malt character. Brighter than one would expect, but finishes deep and dark with a lasting hop bitterness. And then the smoke, dancing on the tongue, with a bit of numbing. A little bit of char. This is super complex and delicious. Amazing beer.

500 ml bottle bought at Running BeerÂ’s booth at HKCEC in Wan Chai during The 14th Hong Kong Food Festival.
Looks: Clear deep copper brown colour; Two-finger head with crumpety light beige foam which lasts for 4 minutes; Excellent sticky lacing with fizzy carbonation.

Aroma: Very fragrant full smoked malt, with well-done bacon, caramel, toast, strong cherry, wood, floral, strong molasses, dark bread, lemon and grass.

Taste: Medium sweet dark malt, with strong ash, fair bacon smoke, strong herbal tea, burnt caramel, burnt toast, floral, molasses, earth, dough, dry biscuits, lemon, strong bitter hops and sharp grass. Impressive!

Body: Medium body; Dry and quite slick palate.

Mouth Feel: Full dark maltyness in a solid background. Smokiness got intensified as beer warms - ashy, sooty with light touch of bacon - followed by burnt caramel and intense liquorices which closely resembles Chinese herbal tea, with unmistakably strong sweet-bitterness which is a real surprise. Sweetness is moderate, about the same level as Rauch Maerzen. Earthy and dry biscuity with lemon to round. What a nice trip really!

Hoppiness: Wood, floral, lemon and grass in nose. Strong herbal tea, floral, earth, lemon, strong and sharp grass in taste; Bitterness is very strong herbal for a lasting, high astringent burnt malty finish.

After Taste: Dry. Immensely herbal and very strong bitter to mouth.

Comments: This one is more than just a level-up version of Rauch Maerzen: nice bacon aroma, full and intense burnt malt, with equally strong Chinese Herbal Tea which reminds me of the City BrewÂ’s 24 Flavors Black IPA I had not long ago. Every element balances each other for a very hoppy-toasty-burnt finish. This is a trip I wonÂ’t forget anytime soon. Absolutely fantastic!

Barwa ciemnobrÄ…zowa. Piana fajna, spoko lacing. Wysycenie w sam raz. W zapachu dominuje kieÅ‚basa potem wÄ™dzonka. W smaku drewno, nuty wyÄ™dzone, nafta na finiszu. Fajny balans, trochÄ™ brakuje ciaÅ‚a. Dobre piwo w fajnej cenie pomimo, Å¼e z kapci nie wyrywa
Bottle. Dark brown color. Smoky aroma. Malty base with some sweetness. Dry woody finish.

dunkelbraun bis kirschrot mit beigem Schaum. Geruch ist malzig sÃ¼ÃŸ mit der unverkennbaren Rauchnote. Der Antrunk ist malzig sÃ¼ÃŸ, dann bindet sich die Rauchnote fein ein. Eine tolle Komposition! Sehr gut!
A great beer for sure but sometimes i felt blood in the nose and 1 time it was flat and oxidated.

Visual: Pours a very dark brown with a small 1cm dissipating head, a bit of lacing, ringed retention with a small island, no visible activity.

Nose: huge sweet smoke (initially liquid smoke-like) with woody depth (lvl-10)-pungency

Attack: barely crisp, incoming sweet heavy malts

Mid-palate: beechwood smoke, (lvl-5-sweetness), liquid medium-heavy barley malt, caramel/toffee malty

Finish: lengthy woody smoke, residual soft barley malt sweet.

Summary: Quite smoky but controlled sweet to balance it out - good depth if you like the style. Mainly smoked barley malt forward.

UPDATED: JAN 13, 2017 500 ml bottle. Pours very dark ruby, off-white head. Aroma of smoked malt, smoke dried fruit smoke. Taste is rather sweet, low bitterness, smoked malt, dried fruit, dried plum, toast. Medium to high body, average to low carbonation. Another really good beer from the Schlenkerla brewery. Probably the best Bock IÂ’ve tasted in months.
Butelka 0,5l. Aromat wÄ™dzony, szynkowy, trochÄ™ ogniskowy. W smaku nuty chlebowe, ogniskowe, skÃ³rka od chleba. Intensywnie i bardzo przyjemnie.

Dark mahogany. Smoke, especially campfire and sausage in the aroma, malt, and some chocolate. Full taste with balanced sweetness that finishes with a rounded but firm bitterness. Full body, and a soft and rounded texture. Overall, a very good smoked bock. Tasty, and very well balanced.

Bottle from Biernavigatie. Aroma is smoked malt, big heavy smoke, smoked bacon, ash, campfire, smoked wood, caramel. Flavour is medium sweet and moderate bitter. Body is medium. Probably the best Schlenkerla IÂ’ve had so far, this is a lot fuller than the other beers. Lovely Rauch.
Ampolla compartida al olut. Espectacle de fum i amb molt mes cos que la marzen. MÂ’agrada mes.
UPDATED: DEC 31, 2016 Cerveza ahumada en su punto justo, el sabor a humo no se hace exagerado y estÃ¡ muy equilibrada en general. Muy recomendable.

Aroma of smoke, speck and wood mainly, some caramel and chocolate are hidden by those ones. Very clean dark amber color with a magnificent long lasting tan foam. It tastes like it smells but with some malt sweetness. ItÂ’s sweet but the smoke harshness and some bittering hops balance it properly. Low carbonation. ItÂ’s only 6.5% ABV but itÂ’s so full bodied and creamy so that I guess it comes from a very high OG but itÂ’s under-attenuated. Really a peculiar beer: spicy, sweet, bitter, with a massive body but somehow fresh and not cloying.
Bottle. big big big smoke, this is like BBQ, a lot of love in this beer great enjoy.
Nose is smoke, cheese, meats smoked fish. Taste is fruity malt, sweet malt, plum, smoked cheese hint of honey, wood, smoke. Mouthfeel is sticky. Really nice mix of sweet and smoke

It pours dark amber with ruby hues. The head is brown and has moderate retention. It has a deep, pleasant smoky aroma. There are also wood aromas with some oak. There are hints of malt in the background with a ever so slight hint of fruit. There is a rich combination of malt and smoked flavors. The malts have a maillard flavor to them. The smoke includes oaken wood flavors as well as traditional smoked flavors. There are also hints of plums in the background notes with a touch of floral elements. Overall, this is a complex smoky beer with combinations of rich malts and smoked elements with hops and esters in the background notes.

Dark copper, clear, small to medium head. Aroma: malty, lot of smoke, caramel. High to medium sweetness, medium to full body, medium to low bitterness. Lots of smoke in flavour, also malty sweetnes. Nicely balanced.
0,5l bottle. Pours dark brown with a medium sized tanned head. Smokiness, caramel malts. Smoke aroma is sharper than in "MÃ¤rzen", but a really good beer with nice mouthfeel none the less.

One of the best beers IÂ’ve ever tasted!

Very dark brown, low tan head which quickly disappears. Aroma strong smoke, sea weed, meat. Palate medium, a bit high carbonation for me. Taste liquid ham or bacon, sweetish finish. Alcohol virtually non present in taste, albeit sweet and warming finish is in there. Actually a classic one.

WÄ™dzone, dymione, ale ta (o)palenizna w aromacie nie boli, nie ma tu spalonych kabli. PeÅ‚ne ciaÅ‚o, wysycenie Å›rednie, niskie. Barwa praktycznie czarna, piana jasna ecru raczej niezbyt obfita, ale zauwaÅ¼alna. GoryczkowoÅ›Ä‡ w smaku, tudzieÅ¼ wÄ™dzonka. Dobry balans.

Clear copper-mahagony brown with a pillowy light beige head. Aromas of smoke, chocolate, roasted malts, coffee, dark red fruits, offers a mouthcoating light slickness, round medium body. Light sweet, delicately smokey and chocolatey with a light bitterness. Nicely balanced!

Aroma of wood smoke, malt and caramel. Pours dark reddish mahogany with large very stable beige head. In taste complex maltiness balanced by gentle wood and smoke flavors and mild herbal bitterness. Overall, more bock-focused as compared to the more smoky Schlenkerla Doppelbock. Medium-full body, drinkable.

Bottle. Very dark brown, average and mostly diminishing light brown head. Moderate, malty and sweetish aroma, light - some caramel, smokiness and some bacon. Body is medium to full, malty and sweetish flavor, light - some caramel, some smokiness and bacon. Finish is average to long, malty and lightly sweetish - sweetish, light caramel, smokiness and some bacon, faint metal. Nice rauchbier with decent body - not overly too sweet.

Tap at the brewery. Dark brown with medium beige head. Aroma is caramel coated nuts, ham, dark fruits, smoke, oak. Taste is salty, umami, sweet dark phenolic fruits. Good heavy mouthfeel with low carbonation. Sadly I really hate ham. So this was great on the one side but made me want to vomit on the other. Objectively speaking it is maybe great.
Ruby red color, small foam. Aroma: smoked bacon, sausage. In the background a little bit malty. Taste: sweet, malty, smoky, slightly nutty and biscuit. Medium body, carbonation low. Excellent beer.

A very dark clear copper-colored beer with a little white foam on top. Nose has notes of beech smoke, smoked meat and some peat. Taste is sweet with a lingering, mild smoky finish. Soft carbonation and full palate but it is still easy to drink. Extremely well balanced and drinkable beer with good smoky aromas.

Bottle. Dark brown color with tanned head. Aroma has roasted malt, smoke and sweet malt. Taste is malty sweet with quite long somewhat bitter aftertaste. Flavors of roasted malt, raisins, dark fruits, dark bread, smoke.
Frisch aus dem Holzfass in der BraugaststÃ¤tte getrunken. Wie frischer SchwarzwÃ¤lder Schinken aus dem Glas.

Draught. Clear dark brown pour with brown head. Aroma has smoked salmon and ham. Smells like a forrest fire with some burning meat. Taste is fresh with lots of smoke. High carbonation. This is not my preferred type of beer. Sorry smoke lovers
Dark brown pour. Tan head. Aroma of smoke, toasted malts, fatty smokey bacon. Flavor is smoke, smoked ham, bacon, slightly bitter hops, slightly sweet bread. Body is light. A great fall beer.

Clear brown color with tan head. Aroma has quite intense smoked malts, sweet, slightly sugary and a nice ham note. Taste is also sweet and malty, quite smoky, a bit roasty on the finish with a light bitterness. Medium body with medium to light carbonation. Overall itÂ’s quite smooth and easy drinking. Maybe you have to adjust at first to the intense smokiness but once you did, it drinks really well.

Legendarne piwo, nieustannie trzymajÄ…ce formÄ™. Doskonale pijalne, z niesamowicie intensywnym aromatem i smakiem wÄ™dzonej szynki i dymu z ogniska. Do tego karmelowo-biszkoptowa sÅ‚odowoÅ›Ä‡. Pyszne.

aromat: wÄ™dzony, bardzo przyjemny, piana niska, w smaku dominacja wÄ™dzonki

Tap into a snifter showing well filtered wood brown with a finger of quickly dissipating tanned white foam. 

The nose shows a big mix of bacon, charred wood, and light peat. 

The palate is light bodied and highly carbonated. Sweet malt forward then flavors of the same smoke and charred wood in the background. Bacon and more smokiness on the finish.

Piwo o ciemnomiedzianej barwie, klarowne. Piana jest jasnopomaraÅ„czowa, Å›rednio obfita, zbita, zbudowana z drobnych oczek, nie opadajÄ…ca od razu, pozostawiajÄ…ca cienki koÅ¼uszek na powierzchni i trochÄ™ Å›ladÃ³w na Å›ciankach. Aromat? Bottle. Thanks to SinH4. Dark brown body with tan head. Aroma is smoke medium roasted malts some dark caramel and hints of fruits. Taste is smokey, caramel, coffee. Aftertaste is balanced between smoke sweetness and bitterness. Nice one.

On draft at Churchkey D.C. Pours a clear cola with an off white head. Smoky nose. Flavors of smoked wood and toffee. Lovely.
Kran. Aromat wÄ™dzonki dominuje, kieÅ‚basa z grilla. W smaku lekko sÅ‚odkie, minimalna goryczka, wÄ™dzonkÄ… dalej dominuje.

Cristal clear, copper color. Nice but not very persistant head, pretty lacing. In the nose super pleasant wooden, smoky, campfire notes. The aroma is thick, full and rich because of this smoky notes. In taste itÂ’s even a bit better. ItÂ’s more intense from the very beggining till the end of the aftertaste. Smoke owns this beer. Typical sweet caramel bockÂ’s notes are almost unnoticable but in the same time they are creating such a good background. I would prefer a bit heavier body, but itÂ’s still super smooth, very pleasant. But itÂ’s definately not a session beer. Rather couch one, for sipping for some time. Awesome beer!

500 ml bottle from Mile High Wine & Spirits for $5.49. Deep reddish brown and clear appearance with a tan head. Aroma of smoked malt, oak, light toasted grain and trace hops. Similar flavor, moderately smoky, woody, toasty, moderately sweet and lightly bitter. Somewhat complex once it opens up. Medium body with a nice, soft feel and smooth, creamy finish. Quite a nice beer overall.

(bottle)
Aroma:ultra smokey (in meaty way),some caramel.
Appearance:dark copper color,medium-sized dense off-white head with nice lacing
Taste;sweet,flavour of smoked malt(meat-like),caramel,toased malt ad dark breadslightly dry finish,,bitter ashy aftertaste.
Palate:medum body,medium to strong carbonation.
Overall:Ultra smokey and balanced beer.

Smell of smoke and bacon, pours a clear ruby red, with a thin tan head. ThereÂ’s a touch of sweetness from the underlying malts, before the smoke comes in. Rich smoke flavor, with flavors reminiscent of a good barbecue. Moderate body, and a nice sipping beer.

Bottle. Cloudy deep brown pour with a light head. Aroma is malty caramel and quite smokey. Taste is also malty and smokey, some caramel and slight bread notes, a touch roasty, clean and balanced finish. Really great smoke beer, love this.
Bottle. Pours a deep brown color with off white head. Smoky, caramelized meats, slight brown sugar, molasses aromas. Smoked, charred sausage, brown sugar flavors.

From a bottle in Atlanta.
Clear dark brown body with a very good head.
Very smooth, near full feel with pepper carbonation.
Very smoky aroma and flavor but not quite to the level that would totally mask some dark bread notes.
Overall: excellent for style.

Scrumptious. Poured from a pint bottle. Pours a deep dark brown/red, almost black with creamy off white head. Somehow a big, big nose comes through that head and hits you with charcoal, ash, bacon, bourbon and general smokey barbeque notes. Like a big plate of slow cooked American ribs. Rich toasted malts and nicely balanced by a subtle but not subdued hoppy backbone. Definitely booze notes cutting through as well. 

Taste strong sweet, medium bitter and medium unami. Again very well balanced. Palate is medium to thick, a little viscous and creamy. 

IÂ’m not usually into old world beers, but this is incredible.
caramel, bread, chocolate, resin, black, clear, frothy, tan foam, lightly bitter, light sweetness, medium body, slick feel, soft carbonation, long smoky after taste,,

Bottle 0.5l. Deep brownish-amber with brownish head. Very smoked aroma with notes of ash, spicy sausage, wood and salted snack. Bitter and spicy flavor with lots of smokiness, wood, sausage, salted snack, some fruitiness, sourish, quite long smoked finish. Full-bodied. Great.
Bottle - Pours black, off white head, good lacing. Aroma of BBQ pit; campfire, smoked bacon. Rich smoky malt flavors, charred wood. Hops detected in the finish.

Bottle. Pours deep brown with a huge beige head. Aroma of smoked bacon, light earthy and roasty notes. Sweet, smoked, caramel, toasted bread, wood, roasty, light-medium bitterness. Medium-full bodied, smooth and balanced. Great beer, perfect with food.

bottle @ hopfanatic (budapest) brown colour, rich body, average carbonated, smells like a smoked bacon, tastes like smoked bacon, malty, bit woody

From a 500ml bottle on 4/7/2016. pours a deep brown with a small head. The nose is smoky campfire and bacon, as per the other rauchbiers these guys make. In the mouth, itÂ’s rich, sweet and chocolatey, with some caramel, toffee and honey presenting as well. The smoke a touch more hidden than one might expect, but you still get some bacon, smoked meats and ash, along with a firm, sticky, roasty bitterness. The palate is thick and chewy, with the carbonation moderate. Big (IÂ’ would have guessed higher than 6.5%), complex and delicious.

Bottle. Pours clear cola coloured brown, with an enormous off white head. Aroma is smoked malts, with campfire and smoked meat, as well as bread, wooden barrels and ropes. Full body, with soft to average carbonation. Flavour is smoked malts, with campfire, smoky wood, and sausages, as well as bread, chocolate and wooden barrels.

16.9 ounce bottle. Pours a dark reddish brown with a two inch light tan head that slowly fades. Taste is of smoke, roasted malts, caramel, wood and fruit. Similar aroma. Has a smooth, mostly full body. Not as aggressive with the smoke as the marzen, but is smoother and more rounded. Both are equally tasty and excellent.

On cask @ 
GRAF 2016 a dark brown with reddish tint big smokey aroma flavour is smokey with malt and fruity character hints of marzipan quite sweet smoked plums and raisins excessively sweet on finish

25

Pours a clear mahogany with emphasis on brown great head of off white foam.

Great wood chip barbecue/smokie aromas. Sneaky amount of sweet malt in there.

Huge smoke right off the bat with some malty sweetness ...bbq in a glass.

Smooth mouthfeel and very easy to drink despite the intense smoke.

So good.

Dark brown/amber color with medium brown head. Aroma is of smoked ham, toasted bread, light toffee, some caramel malt, and some light wood. Taste is medium sweet malty and light salty with lasting smoky aftertaste. Good smoked beer with lot of aroma, smokiness present but donÂ’t overtake beer.

Appearance: clear amber-brown with one finger of light beige head diminishing gradually to a thin cap, moderate lacing. (4/5) Aroma: smoke, wood, hints of umame/meat/bacon, earthy. (8/10) Taste: moderate-low sweet, moderate smoke, mild bitter. (8/10) Medium-light body, soft carbonation, dry mildly smoky finish. (4/5)

Do rauchbiers actually have best before dates? Because even though this oneÂ’s is supposedly past, this is bloody good, is what this is - smooth and moderately smoky, with an almost creamy body. I donÂ’t know whether IÂ’m just beginning to appreciate the style, or whether this really is a particularly good example of the style, but IÂ’m quite enjoying it either way. IÂ’m not sure whether thereÂ’s really a umame presence there, or whether the smoke is just so very much like a really nice slab of bacon, but either way, itÂ’s really nice. (16/20)

Dark brown colored with a ruby hue, medium off white to beige head with good lacing. Aroma is of smoked ham, some caramel malt, bit toasted and light wood. Taste is medium+ sweet malty, caramel, light toffee and toasted bread, strong smoked ham, some wood, light bitterness, lasting smoky aftertaste. Medium+ bodied, soft carbonation, oily. So fine!

Bottle 0,5.
Dark brown color. Strong smoked aroma with bacon hints. Taste: many layers, smoked, sweet, also bitter, alcohol, warming. Interesting and good.

Bottle, bb 04/2015 (tasted 3.05.2016). Pours dark coppery, almost brown, clear, with dense, creamy, off-white head. Aromas of dark bread, sweet notes, smoked notes are very subtle. Taste is lightly sweet, with no marked bitterness. Medium bodied, very smooth.

Very dark but clear amber-brown with a rather large head. The aroma is loaded with smoke, some nice caramel and faint chocolate and roasted notes. The flavor is quite different, comes off like a campfire, with some caramel and burnt notes. There seems to be a little bit of wood on the finish as well. Starts sweet and finishes dry. DonÂ’t think I could drink two of these in one month. Good though.

Bottle. Pours a clear dark brown producing a medium tan head. Unsurprisingly there is a load of smokey aromas here. From smoked ham to burnt leather. Some lightly toasted malts as well. Taste has a rich malty flavor along with the abundance of smokey notes. Light sweet but supremely balanced. Finishes on a light bitter note and leaves a lasting smoked ham flavor.Medium body and co2 levels.

Smells like someone diced up a good ham and dropped the pieces in a blender or the scent of the smoke from a fireplace wafting through the air on a cold winter night. Very dark Ruby color with a small tan head. Smoked salmon or pork hocks is what comes to mind first, rich, earthy, smokey, meaty..... a meal that you drink. One of the better Rauchbiers that IÂ’ve had, seems odd to be drinking it in the spring on a balmy tropical island! I need some snow!

From 0.5 L bottle. Pours clear & dark brown with a touch of red. It has a light-brown, creamy head. Aroma is heavily dominated by roasted malts with notes of dark bread. Initial flavor is light acidic and bitter with heavy smoky flavor. Finish is long and still heavily smoky. Was expecting a bit more deepness in the flavor. Palate is great with a full body, slightly creamy consistence and soft carbonation.

16.9 oz bottle acquired as part of Christmas beer package from an aunt. Consumed during Final Four with commonshawn. Aroma doesnÂ’t hide what youÂ’re about to consume...this is going to be a smoky one. Woods, smoke, hot dog, char...all come to mind. Off white, nearly tan head that dissipates in pretty quick order. Dark brown cola in color. Taste reinforces the smoky notes found on the nose. Smoked meats and a lingering bitterness in the finish. Maybe a light sweetness someplace in there but itÂ’s minimal. This is definitely not my style but I can understand how this one would be viewed as a better than average rendition. Appreciate the relatively clean finish and commitment to the earthy, smoky characteristics.

UPDATED: APR 2, 2016 16.9oz  bottle with commonmac during final four. Dark brown with medium white head. Smells like spiced smoke,  like a hot dog. Sweet,  malty, smoky, spicy, smoke finish.  Taste more palatable than the aroma.  Medium oily body. Not my style,  but probably a really good version of a smoke beer.
Tap @ Fermentoren, Aarhus. Clear brownish pour with some red hues and a firm head. Notes of camp fire, smoke, sweet malts, caramel and some light grains.
Bottle 50cl / Botella 50cl. @ LaBIRRAtorium, Madrid, EspaÃ±a. A: Dark amber / Ambar oscuro. T/S: Roasted malt, smoked bacon, sweet / Malta tostada, bacon ahumado, dulce.

Bottle. Clear copper color, big tan head. Aroma of smoke, smoked chesse, smoked ham. Taste is light bitter, light to medium sweet. Flavor of smoked ham, caramel, sugar. Medium to full body, soft to medium carbonation.

Nice beige head and good black-brown body. Nice leather aroma. Flavour is sweet leather, molasses, chocolate syrup, sugar, beef jerky, very meaty and in your face. Well defined and balanced. Nice beer but a bit heavy and smoky. Worth a try if you like a good earthy smack in the face.

bottle at PO Vaults immediate frazzles smoky bacon aroma on opening the bottle dark brown but clear with dense beige pillowy head, lots of beechwood smoke with some coffee and chocolate in behind, full bodied, clean, smokey, moderate carbonation, bacon, slight woodiness, low bitterness - rauch star.

Beautiful clear dark beer with ruby highlights, weak head and lots of bubbles.
Smell is bbq, wood and smoke. Hint of honey and caramel. Leather. Fresh cheese, nuts.
Taste is watery sweetish with subtle bitterness. Oily and smooth. Smoke and bbq of course. Caramel and hint of honey. Some dark fruit.

Bottle 0.33l from Vlada.Taste at Beerville beer shop Belgrade Serbia with Vlada.Ciaoooo! 09.01.2016.Pour it dark brown color with small head.Aroma smoked meat.Taste smooth smoked meat with slighty sweet caramel taste, also pinch of rust flavour.Very nice.

Had a bottle at de Tolly in Tartu. Well-well-well. I knew I wouldnÂ’t enjoy this! Extremely smoky, reminding me of very greasy smoked pork... I did get the Bock behind the greasy smokiness, but it didnÂ’t help much, I just couldnÂ’t convince myself into appreciating this very much. But as itÂ’s become quite widely available, IÂ’ll try and give it another try.

Bottle. Dark brown with a medium head. Aroma is generally similar to their MÃ¤rzen but itÂ’s even more intense with more dry smoke. Rich malty body with a very smooth mouthfeel. The smokiness is pretty strong but the rich body keeps it in balance. ItÂ’s a lovely smoked Bock but I think their MÃ¤rzen is more sessionable and accessible.

Dark brown liquid. Head disappeared quite quickly leaving only thin round of beige froth. Smoke, burnt caramel, herbs in the aroma. Roasted malts, burnt caramel at first. Lots of smoke and hints of herbs in the middle. Bitter, smoky finish. Even some spiceness in the aftertaste. Rather medium bodied, medium carbonated, really smoky but very enjoyable beer.

Bottle; pours dark brown with some red tints and white head; aroma of bacon, malt, and hints of dark fruits; taste is smoked bacon with some malt and caramel with a hint of dark fruits; finish is smoky and has a touch of bitterness; nice beer

Bottle at green sheep. Dark brown colour with a small white head. Nose is dominated by smoke, like bacon... Taste is medium bitterness, with smoooooke. Surprising but pleasant. IÂ’ll definetly drink this at a kamado-party in the summer.

0,5l fles bij bierkoning vandaan. Donker bruin met een crÃ¨me kraag. Geur is gerookt vlees of makreel. Smaak suikerstroop met gerookte vlees, afdronk klein beetje as en zelfs een hint van wat hop eindigend in een drop smaak. Erg lekker zeker met Heino op de achtergrond.
Bottle 0.5l from Pivoteka in Zagreb. Clear dark mahogany color, big beige head. Medium body. Smell of smoke and caramel. Caramel and some fruits in taste with strong smokiness. Nice.

UPDATED: FEB 6, 2016 Hazy reddish brown color, average sized tan head that left a ton of lacing. Aroma of smoke, bacon, malt, sweetness. Taste of smoke, ham, malt, dark fruits, Medium to full body, soft carbonation. Dry finish. Great stuff.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone
Scura e possente, affumicato in quantitÃ  industriale, bella schiuma compatta. quello che cerchi da una rauch

Not a bad beer, but I do prefer the Marzen style. This has less flavor, less body and definitely less smokiness than then the Marzen.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
average carbonation, bitter, long finish, medium body, medium sweetness, red, brown, clear, smoke, smoke, smoke,

Pours a dark ruby-brown with a very short, quickly dissipating, light tan head. Smoky and moderately malty nose. Rich and full mouthfeel. Very smoky and bacons flavors. Enough sweetness in the malt to balance the smokiness.
Clear dark brown/red-ish color, small tan head. Roasted malt aroma, some oil and bacon. Bacon taste, dried meat. Soft carbonation, medium body, oily texture. //bottle at Craft Room

How: Draught.
Where: Fermentoren, Copenhagen.
Appearance: Dark golden colour with a white head.
Aroma: Smoked malt, dried fruit, caramel.
Body: Medium body and carbonation.
Flavour: Smoked malt, sausages, chocolate, some dried fruit, wood.

Bottle from the Vineyard, Belfast. Looks almost like a stout, but with a thinner head. Aroma is smoked cheese to me, kind of thin taste at the very start then a very full bodied palate of, well, smokiness. An unusual brew, would definitely try again (maybe the Marzen too) but not all of the time...

Clear brownish red beer, medium to small retentive tan head. Malty and smokey nose with tarry and bacony notes. Flavor is smoke, sweet notes, malt, wood, tar, bacon. Hoppy bitterness, caramel and malt in the finish with thick and meaty smoke. This one lays on the smoke and bacon pretty thick, although the body is suprisingly light. Mouthfeel, on the other hand, is oily.

Dark brown with thick white head. Aroma contains a lot - fire baked pork, smoked meat, burned bread, several type of cheese, including smoked cheese, peat, grilled raisins, sweetness etc. Taste does not give any hint to abv. It contains several types of roasted meat, cheese, grilled maize, summer night campfire smoke and a pinch bock sweetness. Carbo is also sweet and light. Ãœber beer!

Bottle, BB 09.2016 (from alcostock). Pours dark brown with beige head. The huge head stays. Aroma is smoke, bacon, malt, black bread. Flavor is sweet and bitter, bacon, malt, caramel. Finish is sweet, bacon and dry bitter. Alcohol is well covered. Overall: great brew, but I may actually prefer mÃ¤rzen.

MarrÃ³n muy oscura, abundante espuma ocre, muy duradera, bonita. Estupendo aspecto. Aroma tremendo. Barbacoa, no es humo, es carne ahumada. En boca la textura es excelente, cremosa. Y el sabor Ãºnico, con base de caramelo y ese tono ahumado, madera, que puede gustar o no, pero que hace una cerveza diferente, y para mi magnÃ­fica. Pide salchichas, y con ellas es insuperable.

Clear mahogany color with medium beige head. Smoky aroma, barbecue-like, smoked meat, ham, wood and caramel malts. Taste follows the nose, again, smoked ham, bacon and meat, also caramel, charcoal and toffee, with a strong woody/oaky character. Strong bitter aftertaste.
UPDATED: MAR 17, 2016 Es una cerveza con sabor ahumado. Enseguida se nota, y luego se va. Buen cuerpo y no es ligera.

UPDATED: SEP 7, 2016 0,5l bottle. Dark brown colour with long lasting tan head. Aroma: Smoked ham, wood, caramel. Taste: Like the aroma, smoked ham first, than coffee. Little sweetness, then medium bitterness. Full body with mild carbonation. Smokey,bitter finish. IÂ’ve never tasted anything like this before, so IÂ’m surprised a little bit but I liked it in a wierd way. Ham stock combo with a bock beer.

Bottle from Tanakaya shared with family for the holidays. Pours a deep brown with purplish shade on the edges. Stronger smoked aroma than the marzen: smoked ham and honey, charcoal, plum, oak, charred molasses, chestnuts roasting on an open fire. Slightly oily mouthfeel with average to soft carbonation. More fruit comes out as it warms giving it a holiday feel. Slightly sweet finish with more smoke.

500ml Bottle - Dark brown in colour. Beech, ash, brown sugar and burnt toffee in the aroma. Smoky yet nicely balanced taste with ash, beech, brown sugar and berries.

A: Deep dark with some red tone. Two finger light light brown head. N: Smoke, wood, campfire T: Smoke, tar, wet wood, hint of fruityness. O: Very smokey, but I love this style! Quite soft mouthfeel even though the heavy smokey taste. Great!

UPDATED: NOV 19, 2016 Brown color with tan head. Aroma is smokey bacon. Taste is stingy first, then an excellently balanced combination of smoke and maltiness. Rich, but not sweet. A dream of a smoked beer. 8-4-8-4-17

Fresh 2016 Bottle, October 2016: I can appreciate Schlenkerla much more by now. What I wrote above is still correct - compared to the MÃ¤rzen, itÂ’s fuller, sweeter, creamier and chewier, but also a bit more ashes in the finish. It is exactly like youÂ’d want a Schlenkerla bock to be, though. Also, full pours look better than small pours from bottle shares. Hopefully IÂ’ll still make it to Bamberg for a gravity pour of this before theyÂ’re out again!
9-5-8-4-17Holzfass at Schlenkerla, November 2016. As expected, just even moreish. 9-5-9-4-17

Bottle, courtesy of SinH4. Looks like Coke with a stable foam. Aroma of German winter kitchen, a bit smoky, Brussel sprouts. Very bitter, nicely smoked taste. Definitely a winter beer, heavy and oily, but also a bit rough.

Rating #1445 - 21.01.2015 - Bottle from CBI. Pours a coppery brown in colour with a minimal tan head that fades quickly. Distinct smoky aroma (smoked bacon, ham roast) from this pour. Like IÂ’m getting the meat sweats from this beer. Very unique body, mild alcohol warmth, predominant smokiness on the palate tempered with a true, malt forward bock beer with sweet toffee notes. More body than the marzen, as well as the alcohol. A gem.

Ich trauÂ’ meinen Augen nicht, ich als Rauchbierliebhaber habe den Urbock noch nicht getrunken oder zumindest noch nicht bewertet. Skandal!

Draught at WilliamK. Dark brown color, beige head. Bitter taste with smoke, peat, nuts, roasted malts, dark fruits, oak and a bit of coffee. Bitter finish with smoke, peat, roasted malts, coffee and oak. Exquisite smoked beer.
0.5l bottle. Dark brown color with tanned head. ItÂ’s great beer with so much smoke character in both aroma and taste. Medium to full body. I will definitely try it again.

UPDATED: APR 1, 2016 Mucho mejor q su hermana MÃ¤rzen, mucho mÃ¡s compensada y redonda. Color marrÃ³n ruby muy oscuro con espuma beige. Ahoras ahumados predominantes q no saturan, fondo a tostado, regaliz, melaza, salsa de soja...sedosa, carbo media y pegajosa. Dulce medio alto aunq bastante compensado con esos lÃºpulos europeos y el estilo lager. Final equilibrado entre dulce, seco, amargo y ahumado. Muy buena.

I tasted this beer in the original Schlenkerla pub in the Old Town of Bamberg, on a beautiful spring evening, years ago...
That was one of those moments that go me into the world of craft beers. 
Much better and more complex than the regular MÃ¤rzen. Full bodied, silky mouth feel. Beautiful caramelized malts, with a slight hoppy present in the background. Actually not as smoky as MÃ¤rzen, or maybe here the overall balance with other elements is more pronounced.
Awesome brew!
Bottle from Biercab shop. Dark brown colour with tan head. Smoked, caramel aroma. Sweet, caramel, smoked taste. Medium body.

Average, fizzy, pink, mostly diminishing head, fair lacing. Normal, medium brown body. Heavy malty aroma, with notes of bread, roasted, nutty, molasses, milk chocolate and mild coffee. Light hoppy aroma, with notes of grass. Moderate yeasty aroma, with notes of leather, earth and broth. Notes of smoke, tar and soy sauce. Moderate sweet, light bitter and moderate acidic initial flavor. Average, moderate sweet, light bitter, light acidic and salty finish. Medium body. Oily texture. Soft carbonation. Light alcoholic, light astringent finish.
Pours an amber brown color with a khaki head. Smoke, caramel, toffee, toast and biscuit aroma and flavors. Medium body and carbonation with a smoke and biscuit finish.

Old rating rerated 21.11.2015, 0,5l bottle @ home:
Nice creamy mediumlasting head. Aroma is campfire, shed, smoked ham, minerals, caramel malts, smoked malts, grass, dark sugar. Taste is smoked malts, minerals, campfire, shed, smoked ham, grass, paper, weeds, caramel malts, old rope. Medium bitterness, smoked mineraly mouthfeel. Nice.

Draught @ Fermentoren w friends/chef+US. Appearance: pours clear red-brown with powerful creamy beige head and lacing. aroma/taste: caramel, oak, smoke and some ripe fruits. palette strong malty and smoky aroma, average carbonation, medium to full body, notable sweetness, somewhat balanced by an average bitterness, medium to long duration and a watery texture. Overall: very nice smoked sweet bock

50cl bottle at home. Dark amber with a medium slightly off-white head. Medium body with low to moderate carbonation. Smoked sweetness with some bitter tones. Smoked malts, caramel, oak, spices, ripe fruits and herbs. A tasty rauchbier.

Bottle. Pours a dark ruby red beer with a medium sized off white creamy head on top. Aroma of peat and smoke. loads of burned malts and toasty stuff. Flavor has a big smokey sensation. bittersweet touches, some wood and an overall quite juicy mouthfeel. Very full, well balanced and very nice example of why Bamberg is kwown for their smoked beers. Long, sweet aftertaste and longlasting smokey sensation. Soft carbonation, great stuff.

This is really a pleasant pleaser. Smells like a smoked sausage. After the initial accustoming the rich flavours come to fruition. Malts, a little bitter, a little bit more sweet, some faint taste of pear. It is very drinkable, light yet packs lots of taste. Great brew.

---Rated via Beer Buddy (iOs)

A dark beer with a small head. Its smoky but manages to have the bold taste associated with a strong ale. It rather nice and makes a decent change of pace. The aroma is not overwhelming, perfectly smoked.

Draught @ Fermentoren, Aarhus. Pours dark brown with a creamy offwhite head, lacings. Aroma of malt, caramel, smoke, smoked meat, sausages, bacon. Flavor is light sweet, sokey, malt, caramel, saugages, bacon, wood smoke. Medium body, average carbonation, light dry finish. 131115
UPDATED: DEC 5, 2016 Savukaljojen aatelia. Ruokaoluena pulled porkin kanssa aivan mahtava. Ei liian lÃ¤pitunkeva maku.

Black-red color with short white head. Intense aroma of smoke, ham, campfire and a little bit of liquorice. Taste goes the same way with smooth mouthfeel and average carbonation. Truly a king of the smoke beers, just amazing stuff. One of my favourites
Klares rotbraun mit reichlich Schaum. Rauchmalze, reichlich Speck, holzig, sehr wÃ¼rzig, dezent sÃ¼ÃŸ, im Abgang leicht bitter.

Prawie czarne piwo, jedynie po Å›wiatÅ‚o widaÄ‡ rubinowe refleksy, piania Å›rednio obfita, zdobi szkÅ‚o i pozostaje do koÅ„ca w postaci pierÅ›cienia przy brzegu szkÅ‚a. Aromat przyjemny, wÄ™dzony, mi kojarzy siÄ™ z oscypkiem. W smaku zaskakujÄ…co wytrawne, wÄ™dzone, zioÅ‚owe. Goryczka Å›rednia, przyjemna, zioÅ‚owa. OgÃ³lnie rewelacyjne wÄ™dzone piwo, te ktÃ³re piÅ‚em do tej pory byÅ‚y zdecydowanie bardziej sÅ‚odkie, a to jest doÅ›Ä‡ wytrawne i gorzkie co fajnie gra z wÄ™dzonkÄ….
Bottle from the Brewery. Dark brown color, super intense smoked ham-aroma, dried fruits, wood.This is a punch in your face. You got to get used to this. Great. Drink it outside in the freezing cold!

Perfectly smoked. Some smoked beers have a harsh burned rubber smokiness. In this one the smoke flavors are prominent but gentle. Like in smoked salmon. The aroma is like a wonderful campfire. The flavor is sweet smoked malts, dark chocolate and some bitter hops. Texture is creamy. It is quite overhwelming in flavor so the 50cl bottle is a bit much.

Treated as a rauchbier, this was poured into a mug.
The appearance was a semi-hazy to dark brown color with an off white foamy head that dissipated within less than thirty seconds yet still leaving a soft level cap of a white head with just a tad of lacing roaming around in a messy sort of way. 
The smell started off with sweet honey blending with subtle smoke and bringing in a slight meatiness (more so like a glazed ham).
The taste was mainly the same sweet flavor from the aroma encompassing a subtle bacon derivative sliding smoothly into the aftertaste and leading on into a sticky finish. 
On the palate, this one sat about a light to medium on the body with a fairly decent sessionability about it. Carbonation runs fairly light allowing the meatiness to blend more with the sweetness thus creating a stickiness on my tongue. But, itÂ’s a good stickiness.
Overall, I say this was a wonderful rauchbier that I would have again.
Cerveja escura, bastante aromÃ¡tica, seca e de teor alcoolico elevado. Corpo leve. CaracterÃ­stica marcante do malte defumado.

Bottled - Nice and sweet smoked aromas with some dried fuit notes. Light brown colour with a thin, but long lasting beige head. Sweet malty, bready tastes with a smoky twist without being too agressive. Some caramel, dried plums, and gently smoked ham tastes can be found. Full body, low carbonation, nice smoky finish. A well balanced smoked beer.

Bottle, 500ml. Clear ruby with a frothy brown head. Musky, smoked aroma. Medium to robust bodied with moderate carbonation. Sweet and malty with a deep smoked character. Smoked herbal bitter finish. Very nice.
This is very, very delicious. Dark brown with half inch of white bubbles. And wood smoke. Some rauchbiers are "smoky", this one is "campfire". Big and bold. Takes no prisoners. Yum.

I lived in Bamberg many years ago, courtesy of Uncle Sam, and occasionally went to the ancient gasthaus where this beer is still served. Were the walls painted with bulls blood? Could be. Anywho, I was not particularly enamored of the rauchbier in those days and never had their Urbock until just now. This is a very palatable beer, with the meaty smokiness of rauchbier toned down by the darker malt. Poured into a squat tulip, smells smoky alright, looks dark reddish brown with a negligible head that does not persist. Good balance of flavors and not offensive at all to this aged vegetarian.

Draught. Pours dark amber, solid white head. Aroma of campfire, ham, sausages with caramely and malty backbone. Very chewy aroma. In taste similar, very solid smokiness, medium to high sweetness finished with solid biterness. Medium to full body. Classic beer, still great.
The first smoked beer I've ever had the pleasure of tasting. Other's can write the notes, a great treat to find on tap at the Three Boars Eatery in Edmonton AB.

Nice brew. Not as smoky as other Schlenkerla brews. Pours a light copper colour with a thin off white head. The nose is smoky, campfire-esque with a light toasted malt, a bit spicy. Not too smoky but a nicely balanced malt and smoke.
Bottle at home, 9th July 15. Pours copper in colour, aroma is smoky barbecue, slight coffee, taste is slick smoke, caramel, vanilla, slight spice, sweet smokey caramel. Nice meaty smoked beast

From a bottle. Wow -- amazing smoked beer with rich mahogany color, some lacing of a thin white head. Smoky without being overly burnt or roasted. Sweet, smooth malty goodness. The epitome of a smoked beer.

(First tapping every first Thursday of October) A smoked bock beer for BambergÂ’s strong beer season (October through December). Matured for months in ancient rock-cellars underneath Bamberg and tapped freshly from the oakwood cask. Similar to, but much bigger than the classic Maerzen style.

Dark brown color with an off-white head with medium retention. Aroma has notes of smoke, burnt caramel and toasted malts. Flavor is wooden, toasty, slightly bittery with smoky notes. Creamy and smooth on palate with toasted malts and burnt wooden notes.

Aroma is rich malty toasty bready with a pleasant but not overwhelming smokiness. Appearance is chocolate brown clear with small tan head that lingers. Taste is rich toasty smooth sweet malt with pleasant smokiness holding it all up and lingering in the finish. Bit of spiciness from the hops. Palate is medium+, crisp with lingering sweetness keeping the smoke balanced. Somehow manages a pleasant creaminess. Overall an excellent. beer. Without the smoke it is a fine Bock on its own. The smoke adds big depth. The most enjoyable smoked beer I have had.

500 ml bottle. Pours a clear, dark reddish brown with a medium, short lived, beige head. Sweet roasted malt aroma with a nice smoky note. Sweet roasted malt flavour with caramel, oak and a smoky, dry, bitter finish. Full body with an oily texture and soft carbonation. Nice and well balanced.

Im Glas gewohnt dunkel, schÃ¶ner Schaum, der im Shaker als kleiner Firn Ã¼berbleibt. In der Nase, jaaa, RÃ¤ucherschinken, muss man halt mÃ¶gen, ich bekommt gleich Lust auf ne frÃ¤nkische Brotzeitplatte.
Im Trunk ist der Schinken nicht mehr so dominant, das Rauch,als setzt sich aber deutlich fort. Leichte SÃ¼ÃŸe, dann deutlich bitter, langer Abgang, Holz, etwas Alkohol. Die wichtigste Mahlzeit des Tages.

Dark brown beer clear with ruby reflekses, minimal white head dont last for long. Aroma: mainly smoked from beech wood (smoked ham, etc), some bock aromas in background (caramel, esters, etc). taste: a little bit of sweetnes, medium roasted bitternes, smoked, roasted malt, caramel. Medium to high carbonation, light to medium body. Overall: good beer.
Smoke upfront. Smoke in the middle. Smoke on the finish. Medium body with lingering singed taste. Better with food (pulled pork) than on its own. Unique, but not for everyday or everyone.

Dark, brown color ;medium -size , dense , beige head. Aroma of smoked ham hits you from the start, with malty notes on the background. Taste follows the aroma, however , malt is more obvious. I like this strange style , but it is certainly not a everyday beer.

Butelka 0,5l. Silny aromat wedzonki. Takiej raczej szynkowej. Barwa ciemno brunatna i klarowna. Piana po nalaniu gesta, niestety dosyc szybko opadla, ale ladnie pozniej oblepila szklo. W smaku wedzonka juz bardziej ogniskowa poza tym skorka od chleba i suszone owoce. Goryczka niewielka a na jezyku dlugo zostaje wedzonosc. Swietnie sie pije tego klasyka.

Dark, smoky, and strong, Aecht Schlenkerla Rauchbier Urbock is one of the purest examples of a Smoked beer in an ever-widening style. Even though IÂ’m new to the style, IÂ’d be surprised if this wasnÂ’t also one of the tastiest. Pouring a deep brown, Rauchbier Urbock has a good head and smell redolent of smoked meat and savory seasonings. Flavor is both malty and meaty. Basically, this beer is a carnivoreÂ’s best friend. Salty, smoky beef and pork would be the best matches. Honestly though, I canÂ’t think of any grilled or smoked meat that wouldnÂ’t be fantastic with this.

Bottle.

A- Smoke, woody, bacon, meat.

A- Dark brown color, dark liquid, light brown head.

T- Smoke, bacon, ham.

P- Medium body, average texture, average carbonation, meaty finish.

O- Kind of what I was expecting. A ton of smoke and that meaty umami flavor. Like drinking a ham brine but not in a bad way. Certainly an interesting beer and not my favorite but itÂ’s an easy beer to drink.
Dark brown color with beige head. Aroma of smoke and malt. Taste is spicy, medium sweet with a balanced smokiness.

Smells like smoked ham, tastes like smoked ham, and thatÂ’s about it. Espresso notes on the palate. It makes you feel that youÂ’ve eaten lots of smoked meat - quite stomach-filling. Interesting beer that tastes better than it sounds.

Black brown colour. Smell of a smoke, roasted malts and oak. Taste is for me unusual, namely I need almost half a bottle to get used of it. But is still strange for me with strong presence of smoked pork in aftertaste.

UPDATED: APR 7, 2015 Pours very dark copper from bottle with sizable tan head. Aroma is insane - smoked wood, meats, even greasy/bacon smell dominating all the typical compounds. Tastes great, like a greasy Oktoberfest. Fairly standard mouthfeel for the lagers with light carbonation. Overall a truly unique and unforgettable style if you havenÂ’t had one before. Beef jerky beer!
Bottle. Amber colour. Heavy smokey and bacon aroma. Sweet, heavy smoke, bacon, delicious
500ml bottle. Black as night. ItÂ’s obviously a smoked. Has a distinct smoked meat taste to it. Too much smoke for me.
6.12.2014. Pours very dark brown. Malty, smoky. Goes well with ham. Liked it more than some time ago.

Bottle from The Beerhive. Clear mahogany body with a thick beige head. Nice lacing. Unusual aroma of smoked cheese, ham, stewed tea and grilled mushroom. Flavour of smoked malts, toffee, wood and a peppery finish. Medium body with an oily texture. Soft fizz. Very smoky and complex.
On tap at Zly ÄŒasy. Pours dark amber color, white creamy head. Aroma of smoked ham, bacon, malty. Taste is medium sweet, lightly bitter, smoked, bacon, ham. Nice smoked beer.
Brune foncÃ©. Fin collet beige. Nez: explosion de fumÃ©. MaltÃ©. Caramel. Noisette. FumÃ©e de bois. Bouche: riche. SucrÃ©. MÃ©lasse. TrÃ¨s fumÃ©. Bois. Ã‰rable. Noix fumÃ©. TrÃ¨s bien.

Brunatna barwa, opalizujaca, przybrudzona piana, srednio trwala. Aromat srednio intensywny, wedzony (w?dliny). W smaku srednio tresciwe, wedzone, slodkawe jakby z nutami alkoholu co nie do konca mi pasuje i jest troche meczace na dluzsza mete.

BiÃ¨re dÂ’un brun avec reflets rougeÃ¢tre, elle laisse une belle mousse beige. LÂ’arÃ´me est fumÃ© et maltÃ©. En bouche, le caractÃ¨re fumÃ© domine au dÃ©but et laisse place au malt caramel par la suite. Le corps est moyen et la carbonation lÃ©gÃ¨re. En finale, le malt fumÃ© et caramel sÂ’harmonisent pour donner une biÃ¨re bien balancÃ©e.
Really nice, smoked bock. Beautiful, ruby colour. The taste is dominated by smoke, ham, bacon - meat aromas in general but itÂ’s not tiring in anyway. Classic smoked beer.

Bottled, with date IV 2015. Pours red/brown, with beautiful ruby reflexes, seems clear even if dark. Starts with a slightly tanned, tick head, but not very permanent - most of it fades out, but leaves around 1cm layer for quite some time, than leaving only a circle. From the bottle you can smell a very smoked aroma of ham, some wood in background. While the head is still there, the aroma is not so strong from the mug - when itÂ’s there, itÂ’s more malty and hoppy (but German style, not citruses). Later, it gives the same smoked aroma as from the bottle. The taste is kind of malty, but having some dryness and finishing with smoked bitterness - but very light in terms of being bitter, but very smoky. ItÂ’s rather slick and medium bodied. Indeed a very good example of rauchbock, worth trying.

bottle, 0,5lt. Found at Valentin - Curious Bierkneipe, Volos
Well comparatively to Maerzen, this double it all - but overall not.
The aroma is a heavy smoked beer, appearance darker as the Maerzen. The taste kills everyhting else - SMOKE AND BACON. ItÂ’s a powerfull experience, but thatÂ’s why it looses overall, you could not get more than 2 of it and even with heavy food it will top it at least. A really thick body feeling. Really BOCK for the Winter season.

Review based on the BJCP2008 guidelines (style 22B). Bottle 50 cl - Batch LVP. AROMA: intense smoked aroma of burned wood and coal. sweet caramelized malt on the background but overpowered by the smoked aroma. clean lager profile. APPEARANCE: dark ruby color and translucent. average ivory head with average retention. TASTE: slight caramelized and sweet malt flavour with a prominent burnt wood character. faint toasted bread. medium-low bitterness with a semi-dry finish. no hop flavour. PALATE: medium body with average carbonation. no astringency. OVERALL: a nice smoked bock, a bit unbalanced on the aroma but good on the flavour.

Barwa: ciemnomiedziana, klarowna. 
Piana: obfita, kremowa, drobnopÄ™cherzykowa, szybko opada. 
Zapach: intensywna wÄ™dzonka, lekkie melanoidyny, ciemne owoce, przypieczona buÅ‚ka maÅ›lana. 
Smak: rÃ³wnieÅ¼ intensywna wÄ™dzonka z nutami melanoidyn o charakterze pieczonej buÅ‚ki maÅ›lanej. Piwo o solidnej peÅ‚ni sÅ‚odowej z wyraÅºnÄ… goryczkÄ…. W poÅ‚Ä…czeniu z wÄ™dzonkÄ… sprawia wraÅ¼enie lekko palone. 
Wysycenie: delikatnie za wysokie.

500 ml bottle from bier-deluxe.de
Very dark copper body, with a big, lacing, creamy, beige head.
Aroma mainly of bacon, wood, caramel.
Surprisingly complex taste of bacon, smoky wood, caramel, honey, tea, grains, subtle zesty hops.
Medium, quite oily mouthfeel, with an average carbonation.
Finishes smoky, dry, wooden, grains, but also with bitter hops again.

Really tasty! The flavour is pretty surprising, much more complex than I expected. Not only various smoke notes, but also different sweet and dark malts and some hops, all in a perfect balance. Definitely the best Rauchbier IÂ’ve had so far, precisely because this isnÂ’t just all about the smoke.

Keg at the Rake. It pours clear deep ruby with a s beige head. The nose is sweet, juicy, rich smoke, dark caramel, smoked bacon, and cured meats. The taste is crisp, bitter-sweet, rich smoke, cured ham, bonfire, toasty brown sugar, wood, light vanilla, earth, bacon frazzled and honeyed cereal with a smooth, smoked finish. Medium body and moderate carbonation. I doubt smoke beers get much better than this. Flavoursome, yet drinkable. Good depth for the style.
Rich Brown pour. Aroma is big meaty bbq. Taste the same with big malt body. Bit too much for me! Better than the marzen with some nice smokey sweetness coming through.
Smell of smoked ham, coal. Bitter taste, balanced out by a solid malty backbone, smoked nuances, slightly alcoholic. I liked their MÃ¤rzen more, to be honest...
Bottle. Clear brown color, medium fast diminishing head. Full bacon, smoked ham aroma, deep and rich, 1st best rauchbier ever:-)
Aromaty wÄ™dzone, szynkowe, kieÅ‚basiane, trochÄ™ nut melanoidynowych i dymnych. Goryczka Å›rednia, w smaku sÅ‚odowe, wÄ™dzone.

0.5l 06/2015. Pours a bright, dark, ruby brown with a creamy tan head which lasted well and left some excellent lacing. Aroma of smoked bacon and charred wood. Medium sweetness and lots of different smoky flavours. Medium full body. Smooth texture. It was like drinking a packet of Â’Cheese & Bacon BallÂ’ which I found quite off putting initially but quite enjoyable by the end. 8.

Bottle - deep chestnut brown with a good sized fizzy brown head which lass a good minute or two. Aroma of smoked bacon, firewood and a little cinnamon. Taste is heavily smoked bacon and brown sugar followed by hay, firewood, grass and a light bitterness. Heavy body, high carbonation. Damn this is a good beer.

500ml bottle from Beers of Europe. Pours clear dark mahogany brown, long-lasting off-white head. Aromas of smokey bacon, smoked cheese, dark burnt sugar. Taste is wood smoke, charcoal, meaty, almost mushrooms thing going on. Medium body, oily texture, smoky finish. Great stuff.

Aroma: intense bacon, smoked meats, savoury flavours. Appearance: clear, dark brown, small, creamy, beige head. Taste: medium sweet. Palate: sweets continue, salty, malty grain flavours, getting so slightly bitter and dry in the finish. Overall: very nice Smoked, Bock meets smokey bacon, maybe slightly too bitter in the finish. Pint at CASK Pub & Kitchen, Pimlico.

500 ml. bottle from Holiday Wine Cellar. Aroma of campfire smoke, smoked ham, and sweet, dark, caramel malt, very inviting and unique. The smokey flavor is a bit astringent but the sweet malt balances it out. Has a slight molasses flavor and texture, a slight raisin or plum thing going on. Medium to full body, sticky texture, soft carb., smokey finish. Very well balanced, the strong smokey flavor is blended well with the sweetness and fruitiness of the malt.

Bottle. Aroma of smoked bacon and pulled pork BBQ. Dark pour. Decent head. Strong smokey flavor with mellow malt and a sweet caramel vanilla finish. Great beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 Butelka, warka do kwietnia 2015. Piwo bardzo ciemno czerwono-miedziane, po nalaniu do tulipa widac tylko pod silne swiatlo - inaczej daje wrazenie czarnego. Klarowne, z wysoka, gesta, drobnopecherzykowa piana, srednio powoli opadajaca, zostawiajaca piekne firmanki na szkle, solidne 5 za wyglad :) Aromat rzeczjasna bardzo mocno wedzony, blizej szybki niz oscypka, z nutami ogniska, drewna, a w tle chleba, karmelu (karmel staje sie mocniejszy po ogrzaniu sie). Robi wrazenie, jest najzwyczajniej w swiecie smakowity, pobudza slinianki, wywoluje mysli o jedzeniu :) mocno slodowe. w smaku - poza wedzonka i pozostalymi nutami z aromatu mam wrazenie, ze czuc tez tosty. Posmaki (glownie wedzone) pozostaja na bardzo, bardzo dlugo. Jednak dla mnie smak ma pewna wade - gdzies tak w okolicach polowy pol-litrowego pokala czlowiek sie przyzwyczaja do smaku i w odbiorze piwo traci na intensywnosci. Mila pelnia oraz oleistosc w ustach. Wysycenie niskie. Goryczka niska, po ogrzaniu (badz po oslabnieciu wedzonych nut w odbiorze?) nieco wyzsza, w strone sredniej. Tak czy inaczej: trudno sie dziwic, ze jest postrzegane jako ponadczasowy klasyk.Ocena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

(tap 0,3l @ OP (Brno))
Aroma: Strong smoke.
Appearance: Clear dark brown color. Medium, off-white head.
Taste: Medium sweet, smoke, light bitter.
Palate: Full body. Sticky texture. Light fizzy. 
Overall: Pleasant smoked bock.

0,5 l bottle, best before 6/2015. Clear, very dark ruby with a huge, creamy, stable, tan head. Beauty! Very intense aroma of smoked bacon, smoked beechwood, coal and hints of licorice. The smokiness leaves not much space for other smells. The taste is unexpectedly less dominated by smoke. It is quite sweet with hints of bacon, raisins, molasses and licorice. Very good! Medium long, slightly bitter finish. Full body, creamy and slightly chewy mouthfeel, average carbonation. Another fantastic Schlenkerla beer! This one is so satisfying and everything but one-dimensional. Although one would expect this to just be relying on the smoke flavour, it is more of a typical Bock enriched with a subtle smokey taste. Brilliant!

Aroma: very intensive aroma of smoke, ham and caramel in the background
Taste: sweet, smoky, caramel, low bitterness

Color rubÃ­ oscuro y limpio con espuma beis compacta. Aromas intensamente ahumados, beicon, y fondo de caramelo mas sutil con toques tostados. Cuerpo medio y meloso, inicio dulce y acaramelado moderado que pasa a un ahumado medio con un final de amargor bajo y tostado.

Draught at Taphouse, Cph. Clear amber colour with a medium sized, off-white head. Sweet, smoked aroma with ham, bonfire, oak, toasted malts, rich caramel malts. Taste is sweet. Medium body with a oily texture and a fine, soft carbonation. Rather rich for a 6.5 % alcohol. Lasting, smoked finish with bacon and rich caramel malts. Excellent beer, if youÂ´re in to the smoked stuff.

This beer pours a dark copper with a medium off white head. The aroma is mostly just wood smoke you get from a bbq and some malts but very faint. The taste is overpowered by the smoke. Some beers in this style have a faint smokey flavor, but not this one, it is strong! I donÂ’t pick up a lot more in the taste except for maybe some dark fruits. Worth a try.

500 ml bottle into pine glass, no bottle dating. Pours slightly cloudy deep reddish brown color with a 2 finger dense and rocky light khaki head with great retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lasts. Nice dense soapy lacing clings around the glass, with a good amount of streaming carbonation retaining the head. Fantastic appearance. Aromas of huge wood smoke, caramel, toast, brown sugar, brown bread, oak, light chocolate, light char, herbal, and oak/smokey earthiness. Fantastic aromas with great complexity and balance of dark/bready malt, smoke, and earthy hop notes; with great strength. Taste of big wood smoke, caramel, toast, brown sugar, brown bread, oak, light chocolate, light char, herbal, and toast/smokey earthiness. Light herbal bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of wood smoke, caramel, toast, brown sugar, brown bread, oak, light chocolate, light char, and herbal/smoke earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Fantastic complexity and balance of dark/bready malt and smoke flavors; with a good malt/bitterness balance and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Very clean on lager flavors as well with zero estery notes present. Medium carbonation and body; with a very smooth and fairly creamy/bready mouthfeel that is great. Alcohol is very well hidden with minimal warming present after the finish. Overall this is an absolutely incredible rauchbier style. All around outstanding complexity, robustness, and balance of dark/bready malt, smoke, and earthy hop flavors; and very smooth to drink. A highly enjoyable offering.

From bottle. Pours a dark brownish-black hue almost like root beer with a good beige head. Some lacing. Nice smokey aroma of a meat market (ham, sausage, smoked cheese), coffee, caramel, oak. Up front taste is a smoke bomb. But Taste changes to smoked Gouda cheese, chocolate, coffee, some sweetness, tobacco and vanilla, fig. Light bitterness. Medium body with decent carbonation. Overall, pretty easy to drink. Up front it's like you just walked into a butcher shop smoking room, but has some strong character throughout! Surprisingly very complex beer. Wonder if I had this for breakfast some weekend... :). I bet you smokey the bear would be all over this beer.

Cerveja cobre escura, boa espuma. Aroma sensacional de defumados, bacon. embutidos, um leve caramelo. Caramelo mais evidente no sabor. Aftertaste salgado, seco. Amargor crescente pela tosta.
W zasadzie mo?na by powiedzie? ?e poprawny rauchbier. Jest w?dzonka, piwo tre?ciwe, wi?c jest fajnie, jednak spodziewa?em si? czego? lepszego.
In bottiglia. Aroma di legno, affumicato, caramello. Al palato corpo scorrevole e alcool ben nascosto. LÂ’affumicatura la fa da padrona con toni di legno, tostato e carbone.

Pours dark dark brown with orange-ish highlights and thin beige foam. Aroma is fig, smoke, chocolate, coffee?, bread, toffee, a bit of vanilla and tobacco. Great! Taste is wood smoke, so much smoke, chocolate, dark dried fruits (fig, raisin?), sweetish malts, toffee, char, and lingering smoke. Light bitterness. Medium body, nice soft/full carbonation. The smoke is a bit overwhelming in the taste, but overall this is surprisingly complex.
Currently I am updating my ratebeer with al the beers I drank but was too lazy to rate at the time. I give the scores I gave back than. If I drink the beers again I might re-rate them.

UPDATED: DEC 1, 2015 Pours brown colour with a small and quickly fading head. Moderate lacing. Aroma is smoke, oak, caramel and a bit of coffee, though expected it to be stronger. Taste redeems the beer, offers a strong punch of bacon smokiness, chocolate, caramel and a note of walnut leaves. Medium sweet, oily texture allows the beer to linger for a while on the palate. A big surprise, expected it to be... demanding in taste but it proved to be really easy-drinking.
Bottle. Pours dark with medium head. Aroma is smoked ham and malts. Taste is spicy, smoky, some hints of tar. Pleasant.
Bottle. Deep amber color with a medium sized frothy beige head. Aroma of ham, smoke, oak and roasted malt. Sweet and medium bitter taste. Medium body. A bit oily feel.

Medium mokka coloured head, dark brown colour, lots of smoke peated malts some yeast some sour touch, medium carbonation and medium spicey bitter some smoke coffee cacoa a bit creamy full body like texture well balanced
Bottle at home. Pours deep brown, nose is smoky, woody, malty, taste is similar, dry, some chocolate.

Bottle. Dark red, clear with big head.
Aroma: Smoked, medium intense. Smoked cheese, some coffee.
Taste: Sweet with low bitterness. Flavor of smoked cheese with sugar:D
Mouthfeel is ok, but sweetness ruins effect.
It is not rauchbock, it is sÃ¼ÃŸrauchbock.

Beautiful aroma - immediate scent of smoked salmon or smoked meat. Flavour is super balanced and very unique. Retention of head was steady, clear coppery brown beer.
